titles.title: Apostolic Epistles / Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs "Revelation of John" / Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros qädamawi "First Epistle of Peter" [1 Peter] (fols. 3ra-11ra) II) Mälʾǝktä Ṗeṭros dagǝmawi "Second Epistle of Peter" [2 Peter] (fols. 11ra-15va) III) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs qädamawi "First Epistle of John" [1 John] (fols. 15va-22va) IV) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs dagǝmawi "Second Epistle of John" [2 John] (fols. 22va-23va) V) Mälʾǝktä Yoḥannǝs śalǝsawi "Third Epistle of John" [3 John] (fols. 23va-24va) VI) Mälʾǝktä Yaʿqob "Epistles of Jacob" [Jas.] (fols. 24va-30vb) VII) Mälʾǝktä Yǝhuda "Epistle of Judah" [Jude] (fols. 30vb-32vb) VIII) Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs "Revelation of John" [Rev.] (fols. 33ra-62rb) IX) Gǝbrä ḥawaryat "Acts of the Apostles" [Acts] (fols. 63ra-129ra)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: The Ms. was written by the same hand as the one of AP-008. The handwriting is similar, but not identical to that of AP-038.

donors.donor: Priest (qäsis) Zä-Mikaʾel and his wife Fǝqǝrtä (or Qǝddǝstä) Krǝstos are mentioned in the supplication formulas (fol. 62rb, 32vb). Both are also mentioned in Additio 2 of AP-008. Furthermore, Zä-Mikaʾel is mentioned in the supplication formulas in Ms. Ap-038.

txstates.txstate: The original binding is missing. The sewing has been repaired by means of stitches through all fols., close to the head and tail of the textblock, resp. Some fols. are affected by humidity, e.g., fols. 3r, 41va, 44rab, 49r, 82va. A few holes amended, on fols. 26, 28, 31, 104.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spinefold of the quires, close to the head and tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(1/fol. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – II(8/fol. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(6/fols. 27r-32v) – V(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(6/fols. 57r-62v) – IX(8/fols. 63r-70v) – X(8/fols. 71r-78v) – XI(8/fols. 79r-86v) – XII(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XIII(8/fols. 95r-102v) – XIV(8/fols. 103r-110v) – XV(8/fols. 111r-118v) – XVI(8/fols. 119r-126v) – XVII(4; s.l.: 3, no stub; 4, no stub/fols. 127r-130v).

taunit.ln-info: Number differs: from 19 (fol. 4r) to 21 (fols. 33r, 44r) up to 31 (fol. 129rb).
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

txlines.txline: Number differs: from 19 (fol. 4r) to 21 (fols. 33r, 44r) up to 31 (fol. 129rb).

rulings.ruling: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The handwriting is characterized by a fine script with tendency to right-sloping and angularly shaped letters. Some distinctive features appear throughout the Ms.: - archaic form of 'one' (፩, triangular upwards-oriented) - short hairlines extending horizontal elements of some letters (esp., የ and ይ ) - strongly pronounced shading (esp. መ, በ, ን, ዘ, የ, ደ) - some letters appear in a forked shape (esp. ኃ, ር, ን, ገ, ጋ) - the hook vowel marker of ቱ is attached at the upper part of the downstroke - ክ shows a very distinct vowel marker - the right loop of ሠ (in all vowel orders) is of a very small size - letters ደ and ይ appear in a triangular shape - ጥ is written with long curves. Though the handwriting appears very irregular throughout the Ms. (cp., fols. 32v-33r) it is the same as the one of AP-008 and also similar to that of AP-038.

rubrications.rubrication: A few lines in the incipit page of Texts II and VI, incipits of all other texts; in Text V the names of St. John, Archangel Michael, the words like mǝnt yǝbe mänfäs qǝddus (e.g., fols. 34vab, 37ra), wä-sobä fätḥa (e.g., fols. 40vab, 41rab), wä-yǝbe lä-ni (e.g., fols. 39vb, 42vb), wä-sobä ṭäqʿa (e.g., fols. 43vb, 44vb, 47va), wä-ʾǝmzǝ (e.g., fols. 51ra, 54rb, 57vb, 58ra), a few other words (e.g., fols. 50ra, 51vb, 52vb, 53ra, 54rb); the name of St. Mary in Text VI, incipit of some sections (e.g., fols. 69va, 73va); the word kǝfl "section" and section numbers; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

otherdetails.otherdetail: On some fols. the word qum or qwǝm ("stop", "stand") is written in red by a secondary hand (?) in the intercolumn or in the upper margin. In addition a red curved line with one or two circle at each end is drawn occasionally between two words of the main text (e.g., fols. 16r, 17r, 94r, 101rb, 111ra). This term may indicate a particular passage of the text or a certain section or may serve as a reminder for the reader to command that the congregation "stands up" (cp. UhlPal 91).

additional.cont: Fol.32vb: Supplication for the donor(s) and for the "people of Ṗäraqliṭos".
additional.det: Zä-Mikaʾel and his wife Fǝqǝrtä Krǝstos (but cp. Qǝddǝstä Krǝstos in the supplication formula on fol. 62ra) are mentioned. The note is written by the same hand as Additio 1 in AP-008.

additional.cont: Fol.62rb: Excommunication against those who stole the book or erased its text.
additional.det: Written by the same hand as Additio 1 (?).

extras.extra: - The title መ/. ግብረ ልኡካን "Mäṣḥafä gǝbrä lǝʾukan" is written on the front board with yellow modern paint. - Erasures: e.g., fols. 14vb, 24vb, 44va, 48va, 55rb. - Corrections written interlineally: fols. 13ra, 32rb, 32vb, sometimes in the main, sometimes in a secondary hand. - Crude note: fol. 62rb. - Crude doodles and drawings in recent hands, in ink, pen and pencil: e.g., fols. 1v, 2rv, 53v-57r, 59r, 129v, 130r.

frames.frame: Fol. 62rb: Simple horizontal ornamental band in red and black delimited by two parallel lines, within a zig-zag line; chains of red and black dots below the band.
